error.noData: No data currently available for this chart

prompt.spectrograms: Click on the baseline and polarisation label to see a detailed spectrogram
prompt.subArrayMany: Choose the SubArray that you wish to see charting for
prompt.subArrayOne: There is only one active Subarray at present

label.crossElevationFittedWidth: Expected and Fitted H Beam Widths
label.elevationFittedWidth: Expected and Fitted V Beam Widths

button.refresh: Click if a refresh is required quicker than the scheduled interval
button.docs: Click here for Signal Display documentation

settings.amplitude: Determines the scale to be used for the Y-Axis
settings.phase: Determines the scale to be used for the Y-Axis
settings.Real: Determines whether to show the amplitude or real component of the visibilities
settings.Imaginary: Determines whether to show the phase or imaginary component of the visibilities

spectrumWaterfall.spectrum: Show as a frequency spectrum plot or waterfall plot

spectrumPlot.title: Spectrum Plot
spectrumPlot.content: For each polarisation, we present the mean autospectrum averaged over all channels and baselines. This is the broad continuum spectrum of the source. For the waterfall plots, images are generated using DB values.

amplitudePlot.title: Power vs Phase
amplitudePlot.content: For each baseline and polarisation, a plot of the amplitude of the visibility spectrum is displayed. This provides information about whether a source has been resolved.

phasePlot.title: Power vs Phase
phasePlot.content: For each baseline and polarisation, a plot of the phase of the visibility spectrum is displayed. This provides information about the source's offset from the phase centre.

bandAveragedXCorr.title: Band Averaged Cross Correlation Power
bandAveragedXCorr.content: For each polarisation and baseline, we present the band averaged cross correlation power.

spectrogram.title: Spectrograms
spectrogram.content: For each baseline and polarisation, we present a waterfall plot of the phases of the visibilities as a function of frequency. A flat spectrum of phases is synonomous with zero residual delay.

lagPlot.title: Lag Plots
lagPlot.content: For each baseline and polarisation, we present a waterfall plot of the inverse Fast Fourier Transform of the visibility spectrum. This is the cross correlation power as a function of lag and any residual delay manifests itself in a shift of the peak from zero.

crossElevationOffset.title: Cross Elevation Offset
crossElevationOffset.content: The fitted parameter representing the centre of the primary beam provides the elevation and Cross-elevation offsets, along with their standard deviations.

elevationOffset.title: Elevation Offset
elevationOffset.content: The fitted parameter representing the centre of the primary beam provides the elevation and Cross-elevation offsets, along with their standard deviations.

crossElevationFittedWidth.title: Expected and Fitted H Beam Widths
crossElevationFittedWidth.content: The expected and fitted widths of the 2D gaussian primary beam are displayed, along with their standard deviations.

elevationFittedWidth.title: Expected and Fitted V Beam Widths
elevationFittedWidth.content: The expected and fitted widths of the 2D gaussian primary beam are displayed, along with their standard deviations.

fittedHeight.title: Fitted Height
fittedHeight.content: The expected and fitted heights of the 2D gaussian primary beam are displayed, along with their standard deviations.

uvCoverage.title: UV Coverage and Weight Distribution
uvCoverage.content: For a given subarray, we display the coverage in the uv-plane. More complete coverage helps to reduce the correlated noise in imaging products.
